title: 114_hr5067
content: The Act is titled the "Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016" and focuses on the investigation of unsolved civil rights crimes. The Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crime Act of 2007 is amended to coordinate information sharing, hold individuals accountable for unsolved civil rights murders, express condolences to affected communities and families, and comply with information requests. The Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crime Act of 2007 is amended to reopen and review closed cases involving violations, and comply with Freedom of Information Act requests. The Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a task force including representatives from various agencies to investigate and make recommendations on cases involving violations. The Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016 authorizes $1,500,000 annually for the Attorney General to investigate cases involving violations. Amendments are made to subsection (c) regarding specific details in subparagraphs. Amendments are made to subsection (c) of the Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016, including details on cases referred to the Department, Federal charges filed, and activities conducted under subsection (b)(3). Amendments are made to subsection (b)(3) of the Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016, including changes in sections 4 and 5 related to eligible entities and fiscal years. Amendments to the Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016 include changes in fiscal years and technical assistance provided by the Community Relations Service of the Department of Justice. Amendments to the Emmett Till Unsolved Civil Rights Crimes Reauthorization Act of 2016 involve changes in definitions and the term "eligible entity." Section 8 is removed.
